alert.note: Alert for Clinton (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 20 at 3:40PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Clinton and southeastern Cumberland Counties through 315 PM CDT... At 240 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Albany, moving west at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Cumberland and southwestern Clinton Counties, including the following locations... Wolf River Dock, Hegira, Kettle, Browns Crossroads, Frogue, Shipley and Hobart. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
